projects.title: Data Governance & Standardization
projects.problem: Siloed global marketing teams produced unstructured data, compromising the BI products used by leadership to oversee a $20M annual spend.
actions: Partnered with marketing and product stakeholders to map existing workflows and create a new, holistic data standardization framework.
Owned end-to-end project execution, from requirements gathering to platform configuration and stakeholder training.
Configured the utm.io platform with the newly standardized parameters.
Developed training materials and led change management for over 200 stakeholders; utilized Jira and Smartsheet for project management activities.
Used Domo and SQL for data-backed analysis to facilitate change management, training and onboarding and keep leadership informed.
Led change management for 200+ stakeholders, developing training materials in SharePoint and managing the project with Jira and Smartsheet.

outcomes.description: Boosted platform adoption.
Cut data inconsistencies in marketing reports.

projects.title: Analytics Engagement Model
projects.problem: The Global Marketing Analytics team lacked a formal intake process, causing operational bottlenecks.
actions: Partnered with PMO, business, and internal tech teams to establish a formal engagement model.
Designed and automated a new intake process using Jira and Smartsheet with advanced automation rules and formulas.
Scoped all incoming requests and provided operational support to technical teams.
Managed the entire workflow within a Kanban Agile framework.

outcomes.description: Dramatically reduced the request approval lifecycle.
Freed up valuable engineering resources to focus on high-impact work.

projects.title: AI Call Intelligence Platform Enhancement
projects.problem: Call classification models were underperforming at only 65% accuracy, limiting data trust and actionable insights.
actions: Partnered with Invoca's data science team to ensure new NLP models met Robert Half's requirements.
Conducted rigorous testing and analysis on a monthly cadence using confusion matrix
Led the end-to-end configuration and management of the Invoca call intelligence platform.
Utilized SQL and Domo for performance analysis of the models and Presented three high-level recommendations to senior leadership that drove the model accuray improvements.
Authored detailed training guides and product documentation in Confluence and SharePoint, becoming the platform SME,and onboarded UX and Product teams.

outcomes.description: Increased model accuracy from 65% to 90%.
Improved cold lead classification by 10%, surfacing ~1,000 more qualified leads annually.
Attributed leads to marketing efforts in closed-loop reporting, enhancing visibility for marketing teams.

projects.title: Analytics Operational Leadership
projects.problem: A 40-person analytics team struggled with conflicting priorities and project delays.
actions: Stepped up as the primary operational point person for the entire 40-member team.
Designed and rolled out a custom Smartsheet Kanban board integrated with Jira, featuring Gantt charts and a roadmap view for real-time visibility.
Implemented a weighted average prioritization framework to objectively rank requests based on urgency, impact, and effort.
Convened biweekly alignment sessions with vertical leads and executive leadership to ensure strategic alignment with a $20M marketing budget.

outcomes.description: Increased the team's overall efficiency and throughput.
Shortened the request cycle time by an average of one week.

projects.title: Confluence SSO Migration
projects.problem: A disjointed user experience required 200+ marketing stakeholders to manage separate logins for Jira and Confluence.
actions: Led the entire migration of the standalone Confluence instance into the enterprise Microsoft AD SSO environment.
Used Atlassian's native migration tools to meticulously plan, Manage administrative tasks and migrated over 100 GB of data with zero data loss.
Executed a meticulous cutover plan to ensure zero disruption to user access or permissions.
Delivered training and onboarding for all 200+ affected stakeholders.

outcomes.description: Completed the migration with zero disruption to user access or permissions.
Seamlessly transitioned over 200 users to a unified login system.

projects.title: Automated Call Routing System
projects.problem: Inbound callers faced a lengthy and inefficient process to connect with the correct field representative.
actions: Partnered with internal data engineering teams to design and implement an automated call routing system.
Developed location-based routing to connect callers to their nearest Robert Half branch via caller ID or input.
Automated prompt reduction, cutting menus by 90%.
Tested and iterated on routing rules to ensure accuracy and reliability.

outcomes.description: Reduced the number of prompts required to connect to a representative by 90%.
Significantly enhanced the customer experience for more than 600,000 annual calls.

projects.title: Global Tax Automation Program
projects.problem: An outdated Oracle EBTax module couldn't efficiently handle tax calculations for $1B in annual spend.
actions: When our manual tax‑calculation process strained under global complexity, I spearheaded an 18‑month, seven‑phase SDLC to deploy the Thomson Reuters OneSource SaaS platform for finance, purchasing, and tax teams across 30 markets. I led requirements‑gathering workshops with stakeholders worldwide, translating international tax laws and regional nuances into detailed process flows, BRDs, FRDs, and Confluence documentation. I owned OneSource configuration—defining tax engines, business‑rule sets, and data mappings—and partnered with development teams to integrate its APIs with Oracle EBS R12. I drove every SDLC phase: authoring UAT scripts, facilitating QA cycles, and delivering post‑deployment support. In parallel, I managed project plans, risks, and status updates for a 20+‑member cross‑functional team using Jira, MS Project, and Smartsheet. Post–go‑live, I collaborated with DevOps to triage bugs, lead root‑cause analyses, and prioritize fixes. The result: a fully automated, audit‑ready tax engine that eliminated manual calculations, accelerated filings, reduced compliance risk, and provided finance teams with real‑time visibility.

outcomes.description: Delivered $4M in savings.
Successfully rolled out the new system across more than 30 global markets.

projects.title: Expense & Compliance Automation
projects.problem: An on-premise Oracle expense module was inefficient and lacked automated compliance checks.
actions: When our legacy Oracle iExpense module began to impede timely expense reporting and reconciliation, I led the initiative to migrate to SAP Concur and batch‑process integrations with Oracle Purchasing and Finance. As the Business Analyst, I collaborated with Finance, Procurement, and a third‑party implementation vendor to elicit and document end‑to‑end requirements, then authored detailed technical specifications covering data mappings, batch schedules, error‑handling rules, and SOX controls. I owned configuration within SAP Concur—designing rules‑based workflows to enforce policy—and extended Oracle EBS PO/AP/GL/AR modules to ingest and reconcile Concur data. I managed batch‑processing integrations, validating exports/imports and automating reconciliations to achieve complete alignment on spend, commitments, and accruals. To ensure quality, I defined the SDLC phases, developed UAT test scripts, facilitated QA cycles, and provided post‑deployment support. Partnering with DevOps, I triaged post‑production bugs, led root‑cause analyses, prioritized fixes, and verified resolutions. The result was a unified expense ecosystem—streamlined submission‑to‑payment, eliminated manual reconciliations, and delivered real‑time financial visibility across systems.

outcomes.description: Automated 99% of manual expense report compliance checks.
Improved on‑time expense reporting compliance by 20%.
Onboarded 8,000+ employees to the new system.

projects.title: Host-to-Host Payment Automation
projects.problem: The manual process for transmitting payment instructions for $1B in annual spend was slow and unscalable.
actions: Partnered with the development team to architect a host-to-host payment system using XML files over a secure SFTP pipeline.
Built a failover mechanism into the XML files that integrated with the Oracle EBS Payments module to automatically handle failed payments.
Authored BR100, BRD, FRD, TDD, Data Mapping documentation for this complex integration.
Managed dependencies with external banking partners and led UAT cycles.

outcomes.description: Achieved a 99.99% successful payment completion rate.
Automated transmission for $1B in annual spend.

projects.title: Data-Driven Operational Management
projects.problem: The Procure-to-Pay team needed to balance long-term projects with ongoing operational support.
actions: Built automated Tableau dashboards to give leadership real-time visibility into operational health.
Owned Procure‑to‑Pay modules in Oracle EBS R12 as functional lead.
Used SQL to query the Oracle DB and provide data-driven evidence for prioritization.
Built automated Tableau dashboards for real‑time project health visibility.
Partnered with DevOps to triage and prioritize technical debt.

outcomes.description: Boosted cross‑functional operational efficiency by 25%.
Enabled simultaneous delivery of large projects while maintaining stability.

projects.title: Centralized Project Portfolio Management
projects.problem: A portfolio of over 120 projects lacked a centralized system, leading to resource conflicts and delays.
actions: Took the initiative to build a centralized system from the ground up, implementing a Smartsheet tracker with Gantt charts and a resource dashboard.
Facilitated weekly stakeholder meetings (20+ participants) to resolve dependencies.
Automated status reporting to eliminate manual updates.

outcomes.description: Achieved an impressive 90% on-time delivery rate.
Saved the team 20 hours of manual work each week.
Resolved ~100 resource bottlenecks annually.
